intro: Alysicarpus rugosus var. minor, commonly known as the lesser hairy sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are often pubescent. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
